task_description: Facing the building to your West (approx. 271°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full vertical extent (base to roofline) of the building ahead to estimate height, so I should tilt the camera upward while staying facing west.
The heading is now north instead of west, so I should rotate left to face the target building at ~270° while keeping the upward pitch to capture the roofline for height estimation.
To estimate the building height I need the roofline in view, so I should tilt up while staying aimed west at the building.
The view has again shifted to north, so I must rotate left back to 270° to face the target building while keeping the upward pitch for height estimation.
I need to keep the heading fixed on the west-facing building and adjust pitch upward to include the roofline for a height estimate.
The camera is pointed north again, so I should rotate left to face west (270°) while keeping the pitch up to see the building top for height estimation.
Instead of tilting up (which seems to reset the heading), I should move closer to the building to better judge its height from visible floors and facade scale.
I’m now angled NW, so I should rotate left about 30° to face due west (~270°) toward the target building before estimating its height.
I need to reorient from 329° to face the building at ~270° west, so I should rotate left by about 59°.
To face the target building to the west, I should rotate left from 301° to about 270° (roughly 31°).
Rotations are not landing on west; using the provided quick turn to 239° gets me closer to the west-facing building direction for a final adjustment.
Now that I’m correctly facing the building at 270°, I should tilt up to capture the roofline and count visible stories for a height estimate.
Tilting up again switched the heading to north, so I should rotate left back to 270° while keeping the upward pitch to view the roofline.
Since looking up keeps resetting the view, I should stay at pitch 0 and move closer to the building to estimate height from the number of visible floors and architectural scale.
I need to re-face west toward the building, so I should rotate left about 30° from 300° to reach ~270°.
To face the building to the west (~270°), I should rotate left from 330° by about 60°.
Rotations are oscillating, so I’ll use the provided quick-look LEFT to jump closer toward the west-facing direction for the building.
I’m finally stably facing the building at 270°, so I should give a height estimate based on typical mid-rise floor-to-floor height from the visible stories.
